com.soa.message.handler
Class ChainHandler

java.lang.Object
  com.soa.message.handler.ChainHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
MessageHandler
public class ChainHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements MessageHandler

MessageHandler implementation that invokes a list of other MessageHandler implementations. The handlers are called in order until an exception is thrown, a false is returned, or the list is exhausted. If a false is returned by a handler in the chain, this handler will stop and return return false. If an exception is thrown by a handler it will be passed along to the caller of this handler.

Since:
3.1

getHandlers

public java.util.List getHandlers()
Returns the list of handlers in the chain. The returned list is a copy and changes will not be reflected in the ChainHandler.

Returns:
List of MessageHandlers.

setHandleOutInReverse

public void setHandleOutInReverse(boolean handleInReverse)
Configures whether the handlers in the chain should be called in reverse for out/fault messages.

Parameters:
handleInReverse - True if handlers should be called in reverse, false if not. Default is true.

setCloseInReverse

public void setCloseInReverse(boolean closeInReverse)
Configures whether the handlers in the chain should be closed in reverse order.

Parameters:
closeInReverse - True if handlers should be closed in reverse order, false if not. Default is true.

handleMessage

public boolean handleMessage(MessageContext context)
                      throws GException,
                             MessageFaultException
Invokes the configured handlers in order. The handlers are called in order until an exception is thrown, a false is returned, or the list is exhausted. If a false is returned by a handler in the chain, this handler will stop and return return false. If an exception is thrown by a handler it will be passed along to the caller of this handler.

Specified by:
handleMessage in interface MessageHandler
Parameters:
context - MessageContext holding the message and other information pertinent to the processing of the message, possibly provided by previously called handlers if invoked from a chain.
Returns:
True if the messaging engine should continue its normal flow of execution, false if the flow should be stopped. If the handler is in the Provider role, this will cause the current message content to be returned to the consumer.
Throws:
GException - Thrown if the handler encounters an error that does not allow it to server its purpose. If the handler is in the Provider role, the content of the exception will be returned to the consumer in a fault. If the handler is in the Consumer role, the exception is reported to the caller.
MessageFaultException - Thrown if the handler detects a condition in the message that warrants the current handler processing to stop and a fault be returned. This is different than throwing a GException whereby the handler is able to complete its duties but it has detected a problem with the message (a policy violation for example).

close

public void close(MessageContext context)
           throws GException
Closes all configured handlers.

Specified by:
close in interface MessageHandler
Parameters:
context - MessageContext of the previous invocation.
Throws:
GException - Thrown if any configured handler throws a GException stopping the close proces.
